text: hello everyone
May I have your help?
I am finding a way to upload the file to HubSpot via Nodejs
does anyone have experience on this?
<@U01S1T5NJ06> have you checked this reference of `node`  <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/v3/upload_new_file>
wow
thank you very much <@UCH1L597V>
i try it now
<@UCH1L597V> it works perfectly. Thank you.
great!
Would be great help if anyone can share thoughts/approaches on this.

Hello API question: Does the CRM associations v1 endpoint support custom objects? we have the definition ID for them but its refusing to use them.
```crm-associations/v1/associations```

Hi there, 
 
Trying to do something that I suppose is somewhat advanced...looking for some input from some of you smart people. 
 
I have a form that gives the ability to enter ticket information to submit multiple tickets, dyanmically, based on user input. I plan on batch creating tickets based on this data. 
 
The form also has inputs for contact information which I’ll be submitting to the appropriate endpoint. 
 
My problem: I need to associate each batch of tickets to the contact that fills out that form. 
 
Does anyone know of a good way to go about achieving this?
 
You have no idea how much of a help it would be. 
 
Please help me :slightly_smiling_face::upside_down_face:

Does anyone know if the Ruby gem *HubSpot-ruby* is still supported?

I am able to read our contacts, but I am unable to simply create a contact with the GEM. I am new to using the HubSpot API. Is there a write permission or something else I need to be able to set up in my account to create contacts/companies/etc?

hey brian!  not sure if there are any ruby folks here, but i know there are some on <http://community.HubSpot.com|community.HubSpot.com>
you should login there and tag @altjx and @garyelliot
(they are nice people. promise)
<@UDC5GRX6E> can you help here?
<@UCH1L597V> would you be willing to look at this?
why the v1 version?
i am using <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/campaigns?hapikey=XXX> and hoping to see the list of campaigns. but i dont see any. i do have one campaign created

<@U01REJKQZ09> for point 1 - yes currently there is no public resource available to download the import error programatically, as far i am aware about.

for point 2 - for reading batch of objects using the unique property value, you have to use the `search api`  and here are the list of default searchable properties per object - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

<@UCH1L597V>
Thanks for taking the time to reply on this.

for point 2 ,my use case is to batch read records using any unique key (example - querying contacts by list of emails ).
So i am looking into batch read API
*`/crm/v3/objects/{object-type}/batch/read`*
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|link> : batch read section

here it is mentioned that "Read a batch of contacts by internal ID, or unique property values"

As per my understanding internal id is the object Id of records.

My question is on the unique property values ,Are they user defined unique properties(custom unique property) or there are some unique fields in Objects(ex. email in case of contacts) based on which we can batch read?
